title: One dead, dozens missing after migrant boat sinks off Malaysia coast
summary: Authorities say rescue operations are under way to locate survivors on a boat that sunk, with two others missing.

title: Nearly 1 million Filipinos evacuate as Super Typhoon Fung-wong approaches
summary: Philippines weather bureau warns of 'life-threatening conditions' as super storm heads for its largest island.

title: Thousands of US flights cancelled, delayed as government shutdown continues
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration is temporarily cutting air traffic by 10 percent to maintain safety standards.

title: LIVE: Israeli killings continue in Gaza, West Bank; Hamas retrieves body
summary: Hamas says the retrieved body is that of Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin, who was reported killed in 2014.

title: Messi scores two goals as Inter Miami eliminate Nashville in playoffs
summary: Star forward Lionel Messi and Inter Miami advanced to MLS Cup East semifinals with Game 3 playoff win over Nashville.

title: Powerful tornado wrecks Brazil town, killing six and injuring hundreds
summary: Tornado flattens homes in Rio Bonito do Iguana, with one official describing the destruction as akin to a 'war zone'.

title: Djokovic withdraws from ATP Finals after record-setting Athens win
summary: Novak Djokovic has pulled out of ATP Finals after beating Lorenzo Musetti, but not before setting new hardcourt mark.

title: Syria’s al-Sharaa arrives in US for official visit
summary: Visit comes as Syria announces launching a 'large-scale operation' targeting ISIL cells across the country.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,354
summary: Here are the key events from day 1,354 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: US senators look for way out of shutdown at rare weekend session
summary: The record shutdown is now in its 39th day and has affected everything, from food aid to air travel.

title: Death toll in Gaza tops 69,000; Hamas retrieves body of Israeli soldier
summary: Israeli killings continue in Gaza and the occupied West Bank as Hamas recovers body of soldier reported killed in 2014.

title: Is Israel inching towards another regional war?
summary: The Israeli military ramps up attacks on Lebanon as Hezbollah disarmament fails.

title: Le quotidien à Gaza après deux ans de frappes meurtrières menées par Israël
summary: Les dernières images de Gaza en ruines après deux ans de frappes meurtrières menées par Israël.

title: Au Liban, au moins trois morts et plusieurs blessés dans de nouvelles frappes israéliennes
summary: Selon le ministère libanais de la Santé, des frappes israéliennes ont tué samedi trois personnes et fait plusieurs blessés. L'armée israélienne a pour sa part confirmé avoir tué deux personnes présentées comme des "terroristes".

title: Sécheresse inédite en Iran : le gouvernement prévoit des coupures d'eau
summary: Le gouvernement iranien prévoit de couper périodiquement l'eau à Téhéran, métropole de plus de 10 millions d'habitants, afin de limiter la consommation et d'enrayer le "gaspillage", au moment où l'Iran fait face à une sécheresse sans précédent.

title: Sécheresse inédite en Iran : "on craint le pire pour les prochains mois"
summary: L'Iran est confronté cette année à sa pire sécheresse depuis des décennies. À Téhéran, le gouvernement prévoit des coupures pour économiser l'eau. Le président iranien a averti jeudi que Téhéran pourrait devoir être évacuée en raison des pénuries d'eau s'il ne pleut pas d'ici la fin de l'année. Les explications de notre correspondant Siavosh Ghazi à Téhéran.

title: Gaza : les étudiants gazaouis de l'Université Al-Aqsa diplomés malgré les bombes
summary: Malgré la précarité de la trêve et les conditions de vie extrêmement difficiles à Gaza, une promotion d’étudiants palestiniens a été diplômée à l'Université Al-Aqsa.

title: Gaza : le corps remis vendredi à Israël identifié comme celui d'un otage israélo-argentin
summary: L'armée israélienne a annoncé samedi que la dépouille remise la veille par le Hamas et le Jihad islamique à Gaza était celle de Lior Rudaeff, un Israélo-Argentin tué et enlevé le 7 octobre 2023. Chauffeur d'ambulance bénévole, il avait tenté de défendre son kibboutz avec quatre autres habitants lors de l'attaque du Hamas.

title: Libération de Cécile Kohler et Jacques Paris : diplomatie ou chantage ?
summary: Clément Therme, chercheur associé à l'Institut français des relations internationales et spécialiste du monde iranien, est notre invité.

title: L'armée israélienne annonce que la Croix-Rouge a réceptionné la dépouille d'un otage à Gaza
summary: Un des derniers corps d'otages encore retenus à Gaza a été réceptionné par la Croix-Rouge à l'État hébreu dans la soirée, a annoncé vendredi l'armée israélienne. Sur les 28 personnes concernées, 22 dépouilles ont été rendues à Israël. Les six dernières sont celles de cinq Israéliens et d'un Thaïlandais.

title: Iran : Cécile Kohler et Jacques Paris libérés !
summary: Après plus de trois ans passés en prison en Iran, Cécile Kohler et Jacques Paris recouvrent la liberté. On va plus loin avec Richard Werly et Antoine Mariotti.

title: Aux Émirats arabes unis, la pluie sur commande avec l'ensemencement des nuages
summary: Alors que se tient la COP30 au Brésil, nous vous emmenons aux Émirats arabes unis, l’un des pays les plus arides au monde. Là-bas, le gouvernement a mis en place un programme d’ensemencement des nuages, une technique qui permet de déclencher la pluie, afin d'augmenter les précipitations. Si le pays utilise principalement le dessalement d’eau de mer pour obtenir de l’eau, il a également recours à cette technologie de pointe, alors que la sécheresse ne cesse de s’aggraver au Moyen-Orient. Une nécessité mais aussi un outil de soft power pour la monarchie qui veut devenir le leader de l’accès à l’or bleu, et qui organisera la prochaine conférence de l’ONU sur l’eau en 2026. Reportage d’Amélie Zaccour et Sophie Guignon.

title: Gaza : la force de stabilisation en question ?
summary: Réunis à Istanbul, sept pays musulmans pressentis pour assurer une future force de stabilisation disent refuser toute tutelle étrangère sur Gaza. Le plan de paix américain a-t-il déjà du plomb dans l'aile ?... On va plus loin avec Niagalé Bagayoko et Antoine Mariotti.

title: Moyen-Orient : le Kazakhstan rejoint les accords d'Abraham, Donald Trump se réjouit
summary: Donald Trump s'est réjoui, jeudi, de l'annonce de l'inclusion prochaine du Kazakhstan dans les accords d'Abraham, processus qui en 2020 avait vu plusieurs pays arabes normaliser leurs relations avec Israël. Le président américain a par ailleurs affirmé qu'une force internationale serait déployée "très bientôt" à Gaza.

title: La Chine réautorise l’export de certains métaux rares cruciaux pour l’industrie vers les Etats-Unis
summary: L’interdiction, levée pour un an, concerne le gallium, le germanium et l’antimoine. Ce dossier était devenu un sujet de contentieux entre Pékin et Washington.

title: Qui se cache derrière les arnaques sentimentales qui se multiplient en France ?
summary: Des milliers de Français tombent chaque année dans le piège de ces escroqueries, orchestrées dans de gigantesques centres à l’étranger. Les arnaqueurs, souvent contraints, utilisent des technologies sophistiquées, ce qui rend leur arrestation presque impossible.

title: En Israël, l’héritage laminé d’Yitzhak Rabin, trente ans après son assassinat
summary: Benyamin Nétanyahou a méthodiquement mis à bas à la politique du premier ministre travailliste, assassiné par un militant d’extrême droite le 4 novembre 1995, lui reprochant notamment la signature des accords d’Oslo.

title: A quoi sert le White House Faith Office, le bureau de la foi créé par Donald Trump ?
summary: Définitivement placé sous le signe de la religion, le second mandat du président américain est marqué par le rôle croissant de l’agence, mise en place, en février, par le milliardaire, qui entend renforcer la place dominante du christianisme dans le pays et au-delà. La pasteure Paula White-Cain, à sa tête, est d’ailleurs actuellement en tournée en Afrique.

title: Sur le plateau syrien du Golan, Israël emploie les mêmes outils de répression qu’en Cisjordanie
summary: L’Etat hébreu a profité de la chute du régime d’Al-Assad pour étendre la zone qu’il occupe depuis 1967 dans le sud de la Syrie. Arrachages d’oliviers, arrestations arbitraires, check points volants : les soldats imposent à la population locale un régime similaire à celui en vigueur dans le territoire palestinien.

title: Agnès Giard, anthropologue : « Au Japon, l’amour virtuel sert de caisse de résonance au malaise de la population »
summary: « Transports amoureux ». Comment se rencontre-t-on, s’aime-t-on, vit-on en couple ailleurs ? Plus d’un Japonais sur trois déclare être amoureux d’un personnage fictif. Une manière d’enchanter une vie sans perspective, voire d’entrer en dissidence, estime l’anthropologue Agnès Giard, qui vient de publier « Les Amours artificielles au Japon ».

title: Allemagne : un représentant du gouvernement taliban nommé au consulat d’Afghanistan à Bonn
summary: La nomination de diplomates afghans, une première dans l’Union européenne, est lue comme une contrepartie destinée à permettre la reprise des expulsions de ressortissants afghans résidant en Allemagne.

title: En Ukraine, le fusil à grenaille est devenu l’arme de la dernière chance contre les drones FPV
summary: Face à l’extrême létalité des drones FPV sur le front, l’usage du fusil à grenaille se répand dans les rangs de l’armée ukrainienne. L’état-major espère ainsi sauver la vie de milliers de soldats et réduire les risques posés à la logistique militaire sur le front.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : après des frappes russes à grande échelle, l’Ukraine s’efforce de rétablir l’électricité et le chauffage
summary: Ces attaques de drones et de missiles russes, pendant la nuit de vendredi à samedi, ont fait au moins quatre morts, à Dnipro et à Kharkiv. La Russie cible les centrales électriques et les installations gazières ukrainiennes, provoquant régulièrement des coupures à travers le pays et faisant craindre un hiver difficile.

title: Le Sud global aux prises avec l’internationale « gen Z »
summary: Du Népal au Pérou en passant par Madagascar, la révolte de la jeunesse portée par des revendications socio-économiques a désarçonné les Etats. Mais son mode de mobilisation horizontal, issu de la culture numérique, handicape aujourd’hui ses débouchés politiques.

title: Après la tempête Kalmaegi, un super-typhon s’approche des Philippines où près d’un million de personnes ont été évacuées
summary: L’arrivée imminente de Fung-wong, dont le diamètre couvre la quasi-intégralité du pays, fait craindre des inondations et de nouveaux drames. Les secours peinent déjà à intervenir dans certaines zones après la tempête précédente qui a fait plus de 200 morts.

title: La Bolivie rétablit ses relations diplomatiques avec les Etats-Unis, après dix-sept ans de rupture
summary: Le nouveau président bolivien, Rodrigo Paz, a promis, samedi, lors de son discours d’investiture, que « plus jamais » son pays ne serait « isolé » du monde, après deux décennies de gouvernements socialistes.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • British Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper on Saturday called for all aid routes to Gaza to be opened and for aid restrictions to be lifted immediately.

  • The Palestinian Health Ministry has reported that the death toll in Gaza has risen to 69,169 Palestinians since October 2023, after more dead bodies were found in the debris. 

  • Turkey has issued arrest warrants for genocide against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and senior officials in his government over the war on Gaza.

  • The Israeli military is preparing to receive the body of a deceased captive soldier from the Gaza Strip, Haaretz reported..

  • Israeli military forces killed a Palestinian man during a raid in Far’a refugee camp, south of Tubas in the occupied West Bank.

  • Israeli settlers attacked a group of Palestinian villagers, activists and journalists on Saturday who had gathered during an attempt to harvest olives near a settler outpost in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, witnesses said.

  • A Palestinian child was killed after an explosive device left behind by Israeli forces in the city of Khan Younis detonated, Al Jazeera reported, citing Nasser Hospital.

  • The Israeli military says it shot at two people, one fatally, claiming that they crossed the yellow line and approached Israeli soldiers operating in northern Gaza.

  • The World Health Organization has called for the Rafah crossing between Gaza and Egypt to be reopened for urgent medical evacuations of 16,500 Palestinian patients in Gaza.

title: UK foreign minister urges Israeli aid blockade on Gaza to be lifted
summary:
UK foreign minister urges Israeli aid blockade on Gaza to be lifted

British Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper on Saturday called for all aid routes to Gaza to be opened and for aid restrictions to be lifted immediately.

In a post on X, Cooper said in Jordan last week she saw "warehouses full of aid still waiting to get into Gaza even though families are still going hungry."

In Jordan last week I saw warehouses full of aid still waiting to get into Gaza even though families are still going hungry.

All aid routes must be opened and aid restrictions lifted now. pic.twitter.com/zNJGSsSOnV

— Yvette Cooper (@YvetteCooperMP) November 8, 2025

title: Palestinian man dies after being shot by Israeli forces near Tubas
summary:
Palestinian man dies after being shot by Israeli forces near Tubas

We earlier reported that Israeli forces shot and injured a Palestinian man in the Far’a refugee camp, south of Tubas in the north of the occupied West Bank.

The Palestinian health ministry identified the man as Abdel Rahman Darawsha, saying that he died of his wounds.

“Darawsha was struck by bullets and rushed by a Palestinian Red Crescent ambulance to Tubas Governmental Hospital, where he was later pronounced dead due to the severity of his injuries,” the Wafa news agency reported the ministry saying.

title: Thousands of Israelis protest outside military headquarters in Tel Aviv
summary:
Thousands of Israelis protest outside military headquarters in Tel Aviv

Around two thousand protesters rallied on the main street near the Israeli military headquarters in Tel Aviv, for the first time since the ceasefire agreement took effect.

The police forcefully removed a stand by "Looking the Occupation in the Eye," an activist group opposing Israel's occupation of the West Bank, Haaretz reported. The police claimed that the stand blocked the planned route of the march.

title: Israeli forces injure Palestinian man in West Bank
summary:
Israeli forces injure Palestinian man in West Bank

Israeli military forces have shot and injured a Palestinian man during a raid in Far’a refugee camp, south of Tubas in the occupied West Bank.

The Palestine Red Crescent said it was treating the 24-year-old.

title: Israeli settlers attack Palestinians, journalists at West Bank olive harvest, witnesses say
summary:
Israeli settlers attack Palestinians, journalists at West Bank olive harvest, witnesses say

Israeli settlers attacked a group of Palestinian villagers, activists and journalists on Saturday who had gathered during an attempt to harvest olives near a settler outpost in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, witnesses said.

Two Reuters employees - a journalist and a security adviser accompanying her - were among those injured in the attack by the men who wielded sticks and clubs and hurled large rocks, in an area close to the Palestinian village of Beita.

Such attacks have escalated during this year's olive harvest, which began in October.

As the number of such attacks has climbed, Israeli and other activists have often joined Palestinians to support them and their right to harvest their olive groves, while also documenting any violence.

title: Israeli explosive kills Palestinian child in Gaza
summary:
Israeli explosive kills Palestinian child in Gaza

A Palestinian child was killed after an explosive device left behind by Israeli forces in the city of Khan Younis detonated, Al Jazeera reported, citing Nasser Hospital.

Mahmoud Basal, a spokesperson for the Palestinian Civil Defence, told the network last month that Israel dropped at least 200,000 tonnes of explosives on the territory, with roughly 70,000 tonnes failing to detonate.

title: Israeli military preparing to receive deceased captive, report says
summary:
Israeli military preparing to receive deceased captive, report says

The Israeli military is preparing to receive the body of a deceased captive from the Gaza Strip, according to a report by Haaretz.

Al Jazeera earlier reported Hamas saying that it had retrieved the body of Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin from southern Gaza’s Rafah area.

title: Israeli army says it killed two Palestinians who crossed Gaza’s ‘yellow line’
summary:
Israeli army says it killed two Palestinians who crossed Gaza’s ‘yellow line’

The Israeli military says it shot at two people, one fatally, claiming that they crossed the yellow line and approached Israeli soldiers operating in northern Gaza.

The army also said it killed another Palestinian in southern Gaza, who it said had crossed the yellow line.

Yellow Line is the newly created boundary to which the Israeli forces withdrew on 10 October at the start of the Gaza ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas.

The partial withdrawal left Israel in control of roughly 53 percent of Gaza.

title: From hope and hunger strikes to City Hall: The rise of Zohran Mamdani
summary:
From hope and hunger strikes to City Hall: The rise of Zohran Mamdani

It was February 2020.

At the time, I read of a young man named Zohran Mamdani, running for an assembly seat in Astoria, Queens. 

I thought the name sounded familiar and it wasn't long before the penny dropped and it became obvious that he was the son of the Columbia University professor Mahmood Mamdani - whom many of us had read to better understand the so-called War on Terror - and famed director Mira Nair - whom many of us had admired for her intimate socio-cultural commentaries.

Curious, I wrote to his campaign team and asked if I could have a call with him. 

As someone with a background similar to my own, being of South Asian origin from the African continent, Mamdani felt like a familiar figure.

Read more: From hope and hunger strikes to City Hall: The rise of Zohran Mamdani

title: WHO: 16,500 Palestinian patients waiting to be evacuated from Gaza
summary:
WHO: 16,500 Palestinian patients waiting to be evacuated from Gaza

The World Health Organization (WHO) has called for the Rafah crossing between Gaza and Egypt to be reopened for urgent medical evacuations of 16,500 Palestinian patients in Gaza. 

“The Rafah crossing is a vital exit for medical evacuations and a key entry for health supplies into Gaza. Egypt remains one of the main destinations for patients needing urgent care,” WHO wrote in a post on X.

The agency said about 4,000 Palestinian patients have left Gaza through Rafah for treatment in Egypt and elsewhere.

Medical supplies for Gaza, meanwhile, “are on standby at the border”, it added.

The Rafah crossing is a vital exit for medical evacuations and a key entry for health supplies into #Gaza. #Egypt remains one of the main destinations for patients needing urgent care.@WHO has transferred around 4 000 patients through Rafah for treatment in Egypt and beyond.… pic.twitter.com/Jzp0KThnC4

— World Health Organization (WHO) (@WHO) November 8, 2025

title: Gaza death toll surpasses 69,000 after bodies found in debris
summary:
Gaza death toll surpasses 69,000 after bodies found in debris

The Palestinian Health Ministry has reported that the death toll in Gaza has risen to 69,169 Palestinians since October 2023, after more dead bodies were found in the debris. 

Health officials in Gaza said 284 people were added to the total after they were able to verify the identity of the bodies. 

The update to the death toll comes a month after the ceasefire between Hamas and Israel, as authorities in Gaza struggle to retrieve bodies due to limited equipment and resources. 

The health officials added that over the past three days, ten bodies were brought to Gaza's last remaining hospitals. 

Nine of those bodies were found under the rubble and one Palestinian who died from recent Israeli bombardment.

title: Second day of Riyadh 2025 Islamic Solidarity Games
summary: On the second day of the Riyadh 2025 Islamic Solidarity Games on Saturday, Iranian and other athletes competed in swimming events, while Iran’s men’s futsal team defeated Tajikistan 4–1 in their third group-stage match at Green Hall.

title: Ghalibaf stresses strengthening Iran-Pakistan ties through parliamentary diplomacy
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iranian Parliament Speaker Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf has said that his recent visit to Pakistan was aimed at enhancing bilateral relations through parliamentary diplomacy as directed by Iran’s Leader.

title: Nigerian Muslims and Christians condemn Trump’s military threats
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Muslim and Christian leaders in Nigeria have jointly condemned threats by US President Donald Trump to launch military action against their country, describing the remarks as “provocative and destructive” to national unity.

title: Iran offers assistance to Pakistan in addressing tensions with Afghanistan
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi expressed Iran’s readiness to assist Pakistan in resolving ongoing tensions with Afghanistan.

title: Araghchi condemns awarding Nobel Peace Prize to supporter of crimes by Zionist regime
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has criticized the Nobel Committee for awarding this year’s peace prize to the person who called for a foreign military invasion of Venezuela and supported the Israeli regime for its crimes in Gaza.

title: Araghchi meets Iranian ambassador to North Korea
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Seyyed Abbas Araghchi meets with Iran's new ambassador to North Korea Abbas Talebi before his departure to Pyongyang.

title: US president openly admits deception in diplomacy: Iranian Embassy in Japan
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Iranian Embassy in Japan has condemned US President Donald Trump for his recent confession that he was fully responsible for Israel’s war of aggression against the Islamic Republic in June.

title: Yemen says it dismantled spy network linked to US, Israeli and Saudi intelligence
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Yemen’s interior ministry says that it has dismantled a spy network allegedly linked to a joint operations room run by the intelligence services of the United States, Israel, and Saudi Arabia, saying the facility was based inside Saudi territory.

title: Sunderland vs. Arsenal Match Preview: Team News, Lineups and Stats
summary: Full preview of Sunderland vs. Arsenal: kick‑off time, venue, team news, probable lineups, key stats, managers’ quotes, and tactical analysis — read more in our full news report.

title: Hamas says UN reports show Israeli settler ‘terrorism’ at record level
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Palestinian resistance group Hamas says recent United Nations reports confirm that violence by Israeli settlers in the occupied West Bank has reached its highest level amid Israel’s systematic policy of terror and displacement against Palestinians.

title: Israeli regime holds Palestinians in underground prison without charge: Report
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Israeli regime is holding dozens of Palestinians from Gaza, including civilians, in an underground prison called the Rakefet complex, where they are deprived of daylight, adequate food, and contact with the outside world, according to lawyers representing detainees.

title: Iran begins designing light passenger aircraft: CAA chief
summary: Tehran, IRNA – President of the Civil Aviation Organization (CAA) and Deputy Minister of Roads and Urban Development, Hossein Pourfarzaneh, announced that Iranian technical teams have begun designing two types of light aircraft to enhance the country’s passenger fleet.

title: Best season to explore Iran’s Persian Gulf Islands
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – Now is one of the best times of the year to explore the islands of the Persian Gulf. With mild autumn weather and fewer crowds, Iran’s southern islands are opening up for travelers seeking relaxation and commerce.

title: Iran-US talks not possible under current conditions
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said there is currently “no possibility” of negotiations with the United States, citing the absence of any constructive or positive approach from Washington.

title: VIDEO: Russian helicopter crashes on Caspian coast
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – A Russian Ka-226 helicopter crashed in the Republic of Dagestan on Nov. 7, killing five people.

title: US border patrol officers attacked in Chicago
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – US Border Patrol officers were subjected to an armed attack while on duty in the US city of Chicago, the US Department of Homeland Security said.

title: US must pay price for aggression against Iran
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – Iran’s Parliament Speaker Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf says Washington must face the legal, political, and military consequences of aggression against Iran in June.

title: Chinese laboratory works on pills to defy ageing
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – A longevity startup in the south of China is working to develop anti-ageing pills.

title: Venezuela sends over 5,000 tons of humanitarian aid to Cuba
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – Venezuela has sent more than 5,000 metric tons of humanitarian aid to victims of Hurricane Melissa in Cuba, Rander Pena, an executive secretary of the Bolivarian Alliance for the Peoples of Our America (ALBA), said on Sunday.

title: Iran, Pakistan FMs discuss regional developments
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – The foreign ministers of Iran and Pakistan held a telephone conversation to discuss bilateral relations as well as recent regional and international developments.

summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – Here are the front pages of Iran's English language dailies on Sunday, November 9.

title: GC approves plan to remove four zeros from Iran's rial
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 08 (MNA) – The Guardian Council has approved a long-debated plan to remove four zeros from Iran’s national currency, Hadi Tahan Nazif, the Council’s spokesperson, has said.

title: UN reports show Israeli settler ‘terrorism’ at record low
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 08 (MNA) – The Palestinian resistance group Hamas says recent United Nations reports confirm that violence by Israeli settlers in the occupied West Bank has reached its highest level.

title: رونمایی از گزارش سالانه نقض حقوق بشر در آمریکا و انگلیس
summary: مراسم رونمایی از گزارش سالانه نقض حقوق بشر در آمریکا و انگلیس با حضور مقام‌های وزارت امور خارجه و معاون دبیر ستاد حقوق بشر برگزار شد.

title: مهریه بدون سقف و بدون زندان؛ توضیحات نمایندگان مجلس
summary: در طرح اصلاح قانون محکومیت‌های مالی که کلیات آن امروز در مجلس تصویب شد، سقفی برای تعداد مهریه تعیین نشده است.

title: اظهارنامه؛ راهکار رسمی و کم‌هزینه برای حل اختلافات پیش از دادگاه
summary: وکیل پایه یک دادگستری، توضیحاتی درباره اظهارنامه و نحوه استفاده از آن ارائه داد.

title: شبانی: بیش یک میلیون آزمایش کیفی آب طی سال جاری در فارس انجام شد
summary: شیراز- مدیرعامل شرکت آب و فاضلاب فارس گفت:از ابتدای سال تاکنون یک میلیون و ۱۰۰ هزار آزمون کیفی آب و ۲۳۹۲ آزمون کیفی پساب شامل کلرسنجی، میکروبی و فیزیکوشیمیایی انجام شده است.

title: از امضا تا اجرا؛ ایران در حلقه موافقتنامه‌های تجاری
summary: ایران با امضای چندین موافقت‌نامه تجارت آزاد و ترجیحی، در مسیر همگرایی اقتصادی است، اما اجرای محدود آن‌ها مانع تحقق کامل ظرفیت‌های صادراتی کشور شده است.

title: انتشارات سوره مهر ۵ داستان جدید منتشر کرد
summary: کتاب‌های «شماره ۸۸۸»، «زندگی خطرناک»، «پروژه سالاد شیرازی»، «صاحب این عکس را می‌شناسید؟» و «فاتح»، عناوین جدید حوزه ادبیات داستانی انتشارات سوره مهر است که در پاییز امسال روانه بازار نشر شد.
